item.title: How to change the Clients Ip in a 667 - 700 - Matrix - Shabba96
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

This whole fucking topic is a lol.

If you don’t know how to change an IP, please, for the sake of yourself, read up on java and familiarize yourself with it. Also use a different base as the one you’re using is probably too complex.

[quote=“Legionscape669, post:6, topic:437648”][quote author=Humid link=topic=540351.msg3957179#msg3957179 date=1332879838]
Your dumb. For 667 - 700 The Clients Ip would be located in loader.java

Learn 2 Code Please.
[/quote]

that means ur both dumb. try changing the ip in loader.java and save it then you will get a 1% FREEZED! so then you will need to go to Gamestub.java AND CHANGE THE 127.0.0.1 ! it then will load and you can log in with ur ips then you host make the client …
SO WHY DONT YOU L2CODE[/quote]

The names are just names. The name ‘Loader’ is just self-explanatory. It loads the client’s settings. It can be named whatever it wants, as long as it does the proper function of loading the client’s settings. ‘Freezed’ is not a word, either. Its frozen.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Rioluu Rioluu
item.description:
@Rioluu wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:11, topic:437648"][quote author=Rioluu link=topic=540351.msg3958081#msg3958081 date=1332971930]

Your dumb. For 667 - 700 The Clients Ip would be located in loader.java

Learn 2 Code Please.

that means ur both dumb. try changing the ip in loader.java and save it then you will get a 1% FREEZED! so then you will need to go to Gamestub.java AND CHANGE THE 127.0.0.1 ! it then will load and you can log in with ur ips then you host make the client …
SO WHY DONT YOU L2CODE

Still L2code btw, 1% doesn’t mean gamstub.java’s ip isnt fixed… L2CODE and 127.0.0.1 is local host so it will connect you anyways…-.-

Honestly this thread shouldn’t be on here…I’m pretty sure people show how to change ip on the actual thread…
[/quote]
You both L2Code, you can’t do jackshit when it comes to programming. Not to mention changing IP’s doesn’t count as coding at all[/quote]
You don’t know what I do and Don’t do… So don’t say shit that you don’t know is true…

that means ur both dumb. try changing the ip in loader.java and save it then you will get a 1% FREEZED! so then you will need to go to Gamestub.java AND CHANGE THE 127.0.0.1 ! it then will load and you can log in with ur ips then you host make the client …

and if you knew anything about coding 667-700 then you wont be saying it will connect to your localhost automatically and wats so funny i said you need to change both of them to ur ip then you said change one because 127.0.0.1 connects to ur localhost not if u WANT TO HOST IT! item.title: How to change the Clients Ip in a 667 - 700 - Matrix - Shabba96
item.dc:creator: @Legionscape669 Legionscape669
item.description:
@Legionscape669 wrote:

[center]the source and clients thread: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,539463.0.html[/center]
[center] [size=18pt]How to change the Clients Ip in a 667 - 701/704 - Matrix[/size]

all you need to do is search in the clients folder - “127.0.0.1” it will come up with two selections “Loader.java” & “GameStub.java” the first bit of code is the Loader.Java i have split it up into 2 sections…

Loader.Java -
search (Ctrl F) “127.0.0.1” alltho its the first bit of code you will come up to… this is what you will find

@SuppressWarnings("serial") public class Loader extends Applet implements ActionListener { public static Properties properties = new Properties(); public JFrame appletFrame; public static JPanel appletPanel = new JPanel(); public static final int SUB_BUILD = 7; public static final int PORT_ID = 43594default server port); public static final String SERVER_IP = "no-ips ip"; //public static final String SERVER_IP = "No-ip's LocalHost Ip (4 set of numbers) **.***.***.***"; public static final boolean DISABLE_USELESS_PACKETS = true; public static boolean webclient = true; public static String webpage = "";
www.no-ip.com you will need this to make a server and portforward for your server.

GameStub.Java -

READ THISok this will need to change this or it will freeze at %1 which alot of you have had…*****

ok… so when you open gamestub.java you will have loads of code different sort of code then java… but all you need to do is this

*Ctrl F Search … 127.0.0.1 and put the no-ip ip on there… save compile both and it will load ur server!!! wooot you have now made a running/online server - only if you portforwarded propely …

if (string.endsWith("127.0.0.1")) you can allways just search that either way same result… thanks feel free to rep thanks bye.
[size=18pt]
No-Ip isnt required to portforward, such as hamachi and alot more…[/size]

[/center]

Read full topic
item.source: How to change the Clients Ip in a 667 - 700 - Matrix - Shabba96
